content.content:
[]>narrator:You're kneeling across from her, connected by the ghost of a saliva string broken up seconds ago. Zero's half-closed eyes level with yours. Your breath; heaving. Your skin; sweaty. Your tongue; covered with the taste of salt and desire. Her churning body is loud and unwieldy, infinitely complex in its machinery.<lc>Zero's body has broken open your skin in too many places to count over the course of the last days. It was built by you when her first body began to collapse.
[]>zero: Hah... hnnhn...
[]>narrator:A putrid and lovely stench of oil and breath and decay emanates from her lungs.
[]>euphoria:How has neither of us... finished... hhheh...
[]>zero:How should I know.
[]>narrator:Her eyes narrow on yours.
[]>zero:Just gotta keep trying then.

It goes on like this. You're pretty sure you've been making love for at least half a week now. Or maybe you've rolled over back to day one at some point. You both prefer the windows blotted out with blackout curtains and ruined shutters anyways.

[]>narrator:You awake next to Zero. She's still passed out. Some of the momentary source of anesthetic dripping both down your thighs. (Or what could be said to be Zero's thigh-ish area). As you roll over, a splitting headache runs through your skull. You're dehydrated. Severely.<lc>As you rummage through the contents of the table surface you make sure to not disturb the delicate arrangement of items and trinkets.<mp> You find a small glass still filled with water and tip it against your lips, and a thought enters your head.
[]>euphoria:Ah fuck...

[]>narrator:You make your way down into the cellar. There, just as dehydrated as you are, is your tree. 
[]>euphoria:Hello, little one.
[]>narrator:Undefined machine parts line the floor: Mismatched wiring, half-molded engines, globs of unrefined metal.<lc>And through it all, vast swathes of green emerge. Unfathomable crossbreeds of plant and machine all over, including the center piece of the workshop: Your tree.<ap> You gently caress the delicate budding LEDs of the sprouting sapling before watering it. <lc>Upon inspecting the various fruit blossoms you find on these plants, their iridescent surface biomembranes reflect your workshop back at you. One orchid droops from the ceiling where an air duct once was. On this one, and on its few siblings that are all lined up in this makeshift greenhouse/workshop, you experiment with the most exotic parts. One might turn into a heart pump yet. Another one a vein with an internal clock perhaps. <lc>All of them bear the weight of a better life and receive water as such.

[]>euphoria:Inventory...
[]>narrator:A shelf with scraps of paper.
[]>euphoria:Bone replacemts are still hard to come by. Buuuuut these silenced lungs should be a delight once grown.<ap> Hehe.
You check your emails. The new ribcage got seized by customs. Ordering a new one takes at least 4 weeks. Under your breath, you sigh a frustration.

[]>euphoria:Fuck... let's just hope her body remains sturdy until then.
[]>narrator:That's all there is to check here, so you go back. On your way back up, you empty the mailbox. What isn't medical supplies or artwork lands immediately in the trash.<lc>One envelope draws your attention. It's official-looking, colored borders and ensignia and all. The odds of this being good news are about equivalent to the odds of you going back to a life disconnected from all the freaks online.

[]>narrator:You emerge back in your apartment, Zero now having had the time to wake and even shower apparently. You were faster with your plants once. <lc>Sipping fresh coffee, she smiles at you.
[]>zero:My my, can't even wait for me to wake up, huh?
[]>euphoria:We fucked for like 8 days.
[]>zero:That's not even one weeeeek!
[]>euphoria:Do you know how much stuff I can get done in 8 days?
[]>zero:Quite accurately, actually. Yes.
[]>euphoria:*sigh*... Zero, I'm...<ap> not in the mood.<lc>I have to go before the circles.

[]>narrator:Zero's expression immediately shifts as if you had just ripped yourself apart.
[]>euphoria:...I think so, at least. I haven't read all of it yet, but this letter looks starkly like a summons.
[]>narrator:You don't let the letter go. After a few seconds of staring vaguely in its direction, you read it in silence.
[]>euphoria:SHIT SHIT FUCK oh my AAAAAGH.<lc>The summons is for in 30 minutes!
[]>zero:Can you make it?
[]>euphoria:25 minutes there and I still have to get ready. I'll go over the letter and details on my way.
[]>narrator:You speedrun your "morning" routine (it's afternoon), and bolt off. Zero gets one peck before then.

content.name: key
content.value: Failure to Comply Will Result in Death

content.content: You run up the steps of the First Circle of Eden. Public transit fucked you over so you're late 6 minutes despite your best efforts. The receptionist points you to the room of your proceedings.
[]>narrator:As politely as you can manage with your brisk pace, you knock and enter the roo--

[]>oldrone:Noncompliance with paragraph three hundred ninety two point B of the third amendment of the statute of beaurocratic compliance, the defendant incurs a penalty of up to 300 kron per minute idle.<lc>Take a seat.
[]>narrator:You silently shuffle to the chair that's obviously intended to be yours.
[]>oldrone:We appreciate your cooperation. Beginning now, is case number #5r64.1987.1, State Hearing of M_. ____, accused of continued illegal distribution of technoflora. Goal of the hearing is either confession or mounted defense, M_. ____ represented by M_. ____. No prior comments were submitted, or if they were, were not approved, therefore the hearing begins henceforth.<lc>Before you sits I, District Judge Oldrone, with specialty in cases of smuggling and illegal trade.<lc>M_. ____. You have been summoned here today to discuss your allegedly illicit activities. Seven months in the past, you were ordered to cease all personal cultivation of technofloral specimens. Six days in the past, we seized a cache of unlicensed technofloral produce, which seems to be genetically linked to the specimens you submitted seven months in the past for seizure and destruction. This is giving us confidence in the claim, you may have kept a sprout of that lineage. We gracefully extended an offer then of incorporating you in the State Circle Gardener Education and Reeducation Program, an offer to which you have failed to reply to in these seven months. That offer is now invalid. If you wish to explain this reappearance of illicit technoflora, you may do so now. Bear in mind, do not visibly or audibly react during the proceedings.

choices.choice_text.disabled: Spill the beans (You don't want to die *here*, do you?)

content.content:
[]>euphoria: Your honor, they are not mine. They may be the result of seed extractions someone conducted on the already circulating plants, technoflora, that's- that are out there. Recently, I got into buying what I want, instead of growing it myself. All of the vendors appeared legitimate.
[]>oldrone:Please remain cognizant of your statements not contempting the court. Just mere days ago, a shipment of controlled parts destined to you was seized.
[]>euphoria:As I elaborated, they appeared legitimate. As per ยง451 of the federated vendor bill, I am entitled to the assumption of trade in good faith.
[]>narrator:Oldrone adjusts his spectacles. He lets out an exasperated sigh.
[]>oldrone:Even that may be true. Yet, when we searched your apartment four days in the past, we seized another specimen, of same lineage. It would have been ripe in just over two weeks.
[]>euphoria:I would have been there when you searched.
[]>oldrone:It seemed you were occupied with sexual practices.
[]>euphoria:[Did they forget the fucking basement???]<lc>I was not informed of this.
[]>oldrone:That would defeat the point of a search, would it not? Please do not waste this circle's time with tautologies.
[]>euphoria:I apologize. <mp>But even so, I maintain that even any specimen you may allege to find in my domicile, is also not mine or in my care.
[]>oldrone:Come again? Who else has access to your apartment?

[]>euphoria:No one else. And any malicious actors willing to accuse me. Ties to my illegal activity months ago may still hold me back.
[]>oldrone:Ridiculous.
[]>euphoria:I urge you to sample the specimen you seized, if it exists. Find any of my biological byproducts older than a week, such as exhaled carbon dioxide or the trace aminos of dead skill cells.<lc>Until then, under ยง9178.a of the narcotics and bio statute, which defines ownership of domestically held blooming organisms by continued shared physical proximity for over a week or during the bearing of produce, you cannot posit that this supposed-to-exist specimen is mine.
[]>narrator:Oldrone's stare burns with dejected hatred.
[]>oldrone:We will pause the proceedings. You will receive another summons should this not prove a valid objection...<mp> Dismissed.
[]>narrator:You bow your head and wordlessly leave the room.

[]>narrator:Your gaze is empty. So are your thoughts. You don't remember the ride home as soon as you pass the doorstep.<lc>You find Zero on the kitchen floor, nursing a cup of vitamin supplement tea and a bag of chips. Slowly, she turns her head and stares at you with a look that says "I understand you don't want to, but please tell me how bad it is".<lc>You answer.
[]>euphoria:It's bad. <ap>Very bad. <ap>We're fucked. <ap>They found out, I don't know how but they found out.
[]>zero:How even?

[]>euphoria:Probably one of the people I supplied left some shit out. I don't know. <ap>I don't care. <ap>God.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:Or even supposedly because they got one from here? <ap>But I didn't notice anything missing.
[]>zero:They will just lie to you to pin you down with anything.
[]>euphoria:I know, had to... bring up a whole lot of shitfuck knowledge.
[]>euphoria:...
[]>euphoria:THOSE OLD FUCKS "EITHER JOIN OUR CULT OR SEIZE YOUR CULTIVATION!"<lc>OH YEA BECAUSE I'M DOING ALL THIS FOR FUN AND NOT TO SURVIVE!
[]>euphoria:...
[]>euphoria:Fuck...

[]>euphoria:Fuck, sorry, I didn't mean to shout. <mp>I'm just so tired.
[]>zero:...<ap>Aren't we also running out of time?
[]>euphoria:We sure as hell are.

[]>euphoria:Fuck fuck fuck...
[]>narrator:It is now late afternoon. You can barely focus on making progress for the ritual.
[]>euphoria:Fuck the circles, fuck it all.<ap> No matter. I'll focus on working for now. Easy tasks, Euphoria, easy tasks.
[]>narrator:You find your work unsteady. Yet, you tend to the plants.

[]>euphoria:At least the heartchamber is holding up. I still can't believe I pulled that off... <lc>Or that Zero was willing to donate that high of a price. But now we're thriving with it, and the world after us... or after me... will too.
[]>narrator:The ever subtle pulse of the chamber underneath the building gives the workshop a synchronized and ticking clock. The yet small embedded LEDs in the tree before you give you an accurate flash on every beat.
[]>euphoria:The guiding lights of the machine titans, yes? Delicate and wispy LEDs, eternally pulsing. So broody.
[]>narrator:You bask in the aura of your workshop and its creations.
[]>euphoria:...I wish I could kill Oldrone myself before the ritual. <mp>Enjoy the mercy, dickbag.

[]>narrator:You hear steps descend down the basement.
[]>zero:Hi there! Thought I'd check on you!
[]>euphoria:I'm doing great. Actually that sounded so sarcastic. Yes I'm doing fine.
[]>zero:I'm glad!
[]>narrator:She gives you a hug.
[]>zero:I'm just so happy you returned.
[]>euphoria: Why wouldn't I return?
[]>zero:Immediate execution. <ap>Jail. <ap>Hit by a car. <ap>Something bad.
[]>euphoria: I wouldn't be that easy to kill. Especially not to some goverment lowlives.
[]>zero:You always say so...
[]>euphoria:Because it's true!
[]>zero:...Probably.<lc>I'm just happy to be with you.
[]>euphoria:Me too...
[]>zero:...<lc>Say, you've been down here for a few hours now, yes? Oh and by the way, don't let that state pig occupy too much of your mind. He's not worth it.
[]>euphoria:Ugh I know. Existential threats are just never fun. But yes? I probably have. Gotta make progress at some point instead of just thinking about it.
[]>zero:But you've made so much progress already today!

[]>zero:I propose you take a break.
[]>euphoria:I still gotta work more though...
[]>zero:Please?
[]>narrator:She moves in closer, nuzzling her head against your chest.
[]>euphoria:This doesn't change the state of work.
[]>narrator:Her arms trail down your spine.
[]>zero:But you could change the state of me...
[]>euphoria:So smooth.
[]>zero:Shuddup.
[]>narrator:Zero continues dragging her sharp claws up and down your back.
[]>zero:You look good when you shiver like that.
[]>narrator:And you like when you look good.
Fine. Let me finish up and then I'll come with.

[]>narrator:As soon as you step through the apartment door, your headspace shifts. What you perceived as a slight disturbance and distraction in your workshop mere moments ago, is now a much different beast.
[]>euphoria:You're lucky you're this cute.
[]>narrator:You push Zero down to the floor. You made sure to give her new parts all the sensoric feedback cycles imaginable when you installed them. And you indulge in that fact, kissing the metal and bones and wires all over your lover while you occupy her mouth with your fingers. In the morning, you'll realize you never even made it to the bed before sunrise.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:Thank you for bringing me up here again. You're so fun to consume.
[]>zero:*muffled, flustered approval*
[]>euphoria:...and indulge in.
[]>narrator:You shift your weight up.
[]>euphoria:Is it okay for you if I sit on your face?
[]>narrator:With massive eyes, she nods.
[]>euphoria:Hehe.... thank you.
[]>narrator:The temperature fluctuations of her facial actuators send literal and metaphorical shivers down your spine. <mp>As you grind on Zero's face, the microscopic and macroscopic mandibles of her jaw area lacerate your thighs and nethers in all the right places. When this happened the first time, Zero was mortified, understandably. <lc>But this is different from those parts of your past. It is willed. It took Zero time to realize that this was her seeing you in a safe and controlled environment with what once was a dangerous coping mechanism to you. You feel safe, letting yourself fall like this around her.<lc>Gracefully, you dance your hips across that razor field, always staying on the edge (in both ways), but never crossing-<ap> one of them.<mp> If one were have permission to exsanguinate you, it would only be yourself. <mp>You cover her with your... cum.... or whatever it is now.<lc>Over the next hours this becomes a repeat occurrence, the only external thing either of you is ever concerned with being the computer wiring on the floor not getting shorted by your escapades.

[]>euphoria:This is great...
[]>narrator:You are both breathing with tremendous effort.
[]>zero:Hah... you are...
[]>euphoria:As are you.
[]>narrator:A small kiss on Zero's cheek.<lc>You almost pass out on her, so you roll over next to Zero.
[]>euphoria:Hey... could you stand up? I wanna try something.
[]>zero:What is it?
[]>euphoria:I'm fairly confident this will work. Just hold me.

[]>zero:??? o...k...
[]>narrator:And she gets up-<mp> Standing across from her now, you give her a tender kiss... and break away again. You build up a most minute momentum and swing one of your legs up, and into Zero's leg chassis. The wall behind her receives a small arc of blood. You look down.

[]>euphoria:Still good... hehe...
[]>narrator:And the other leg goes up to Zero's immediate shock. She's now holding your close, very close in fact, to her own torso, lest you fall down with your legs now locked behind her- Even almost making Zero fall over backwards if it weren't for the ridiculously strong hind legs of hers.
[]>euphoria:Thank you...
[]>zero:You could've just asked for a hug, y'know?
[]>euphoria:I know... but being this close to you... I just had to.

[]>zero:But what if I wouldn't've been able to hold you?
[]>euphoria:I just knew you could hold me!
[]>zero:Old me couldn't...
[]>euphoria:And why does that matter now?
[]>zero:Do you... do you think I'm still beautiful?

[]>euphoria:Of course.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:Do you think I got into you because of your looks?

[]>zero:Initially most people judge others on appearance.
[]>euphoria:Well maybe,<ap> but I really do like you! And I think you're a joy to look at.
[]>zero:...<lc>I'm happy to hear that.
[]>euphoria:...and a joy to be close to.<lc>Also it's my work that you let this do this to you. That makes it so much cooler.
[]>zero:Yeah...<lc>Thank you.
[]>euphoria:But even if I didn't build you up... <ap>you being comfortable in your own body is the most attractive thing there is.
[]>zero:Oh my god stop >.<
[]>euphoria:Haha! It was you who asked.
[]>narrator:Zero nuzzles into you. You ruffle her hair.

[]>narrator:It's been a long night. Yet, with no set work schedule to bother you, you awake well-rested.
[]>zero:Cheeeee.....
[]>narrator:You find Zero staring at you when you awake.
[]>euphoria:Good morning.
[]>zero:Ehehe....
[]>narrator:She squeezes you tightly.
[]>euphoria:Slept well?
[]>zero:Very well!
[]>narrator:The smaller extremeties of her abdomen tickle your legs.
[]>euphoria:...
[]>euphoria:Alrighty I gotta get up now.
[]>zero:Wait why?
[]>euphoria:I still have unfinished work to do from yesterday!
[]>zero:Ugh fine. I'll clean up the apartment a bit.
[]>euphoria:Thank you.
[]>narrator:You give her a kiss on her forehead.

[]>narrator:When you return to the living room after around two hours, Zero is visibly deflated. She stares dejectedly and absent-mindedly at the wallpaper while the room is filled by the dissonance of ambient noise music. When you let your gaze wander for a bit, there's a new letter on the table. It wasn't there when you left.
[]>narrator:She tries to choke out syllables. The trembling in her voice is too strong to vocalize anything. You move in to hold her tight. <lc>Minutes pass. Small wet spots have now formed on your chest.
[]>zero:I... <ap><ap>hate this body.
[]>narrator:Her voice is filled with despair, anger and the revenants of choked tears. She breaks away.
[]>euphoria:...
[]>zero:It's not even worth the upkeep. Read the letter.
[]>narrator:While you read, Zero stares out the window.
[]>euphoria:...

[]>euphoria:You're gonna lose your eye?
[]>zero:One week. Then it'll be in my brain.
[]>narrator:You stare at each other. No attempt at movement emanates from Zero's body.
[]>euphoria:Shit...<ap> Can I give you a hug?
[]>zero:...please...
[]>narrator:You gently guide her to the couch again. You take place atop her and press your form into her, trying to comfort whatever part of her soul is not completely annihilated right now. Both of you stay like this for the rest of the day, only stirred when you decide to get food for Zero and you.

[]>euphoria:I have an idea.
[]>zero:It won't grow that fast.
[]>euphoria:Not the plants. Another method. And I know you know.
[]>zero:...Euphoria... You don't have to do this.
[]>euphoria:We still have stuff to do. And you need a fix now. I'll be fine.
[]>zero:Do you want me to move somewhere else?
[]>euphoria:The workshop gurney please. I'll grab my tools and be there in a bit.

You give Zero a kiss on the cheek, and watch her depart down to your workshop. The diligence you employ to find all the tools you need is only appropriate for the task of a lifetime. Exactly, precisely appropriate. As you get the gauze and other surgical supplies from the bathroom, you take one last look in the mirror, memorizing the look on your face, and practicing your expression for when Zero looks at you again after this. And then you descend.

[]>euphoria:Lay down please. I'll fasten you now.
[]>narrator:Zero wordlessly complies. Her expression is empty, no defenses or reactions emenating. Complete and utter trust for you. You tie her down, head rested on the softest pillow. You apply the anesthetic gel to her orbital area and in a few minutes you too, are ready.

[]>narrator:Everything slowly grows into focus again. Tear-like drops of blood run down the skin and wiring of your face. But as the lights flood your cornea, a distant pressure seems to have been evaporated. Before you, stands Euphoria. Her face bears the widest and most pure grin, radiant like a supernova. Not even the deep vermillion void in her eye socket able to mar this pride.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:Ehehe... I hope you like it.
[]>zero:Euphoria... we could've grown more.
[]>euphoria:But you needed it now.
[]>zero:...

[]>euphoria:I couldn't watch you... your brain get eaten by itself.
[]>zero:...You're sweet.
[]>euphoria:Have you looked at yourself? I think we're way past the point of it being new that I care about you.
[]>zero:...Still.<lc>Can I... have a kiss?
[]>narrator:Euphoria wordlessly moves in and fulfills your request.
[]>narrator:After some time, she straightens back up, needing to be braced over the gurney like that probably a bit too uncomfortable after such a surgery.
[]>euphoria:Besides, I don't even know of the quality of the plants. I know of the quality of my own.<mp> But enough about that.
[]>narrator:Euphoria pats your head. Your body is weak now. It has been for a long time but now it feels more so. Surgery still takes its toll on you.
[]>euphoria:So how are you feeling right now? Or still too early to tell?
[]>zero:My eye feels weird.
[]>euphoria:I think that's to be expected.
[]>zero:Probably.
[]>zero:Give me a few more moments, then I can decide...<lc>...

[]>zero:Can I... Can I lay here for a bit?
[]>narrator:You can barely turn your head. Damn weakness.
[]>euphoria:Of course. I'll bring you food if that's alright with you.
[]>zero:Th... thank you.
[]>euphoria:I haven't gotten anything yet, hehe.
[]>narrator:Euphoria does a happy twirl and ascends the steps to your apartment. There are no clocks down here. Not even in your hardest try could you ascertain the day, let alone the time in it.

[]>zero:Soooo... this is it, huh? Haven't been down here behind the curtains in a while.
[]>narrator:Leaves spliced with wires drape themselves over the operating curtain.
[]>zero:We kept that palm? I wanna game. We can make a game thing out of it.
[]>narrator:A small pristine potted fern on the alcove next to you keeps you company. It might be the only thing down here not laced with metal scars. The leaves are strange to the touch.
[]>zero:So soft...
[]>euphoria:As are you!
[]>narrator:An echo down the stairwell.<mp> The source trails shortly behind.
[]>zero:What remains of my skin... I guess.
[]>euphoria:And everything else too, you know. Your alloys comfort me too.
[]>zero:You made them.
[]>euphoria:That's why they're good.
[]>narrator:Euphoria sets down a tray.
[]>euphoria:Veggie sticks! And dino nuggies!
[]>narrator:The lizard-shaped protein preparations were always a source of comfort. You're glad they are compatible with your internals. Not everything is.
[]>zero:Hungry...
[]>euphoria:Well, dig in. I'm gonna steal a few from you though.
[]>zero:Feel free.
[]>narrator:She procures two forks and hands you one.

[]>narrator:Days have passed. You can now see like before, perhaps even a smidgen better. Definitely a smidgen better. During your breaks, you visit Euphoria in her workshop across the basement hallway, watching her tend to her plants. This is where you always get your machine parts. <lc>You lean against the handle of your trolley. On it, crates, pallets, and boxes regularly find their place, filled with all the things you ask of Euphoria. This time it's elbow joints. They still have their blackberry brambles. <lc>Right now, Euphoria seems to prepare the crate of ocular stems you requested from her. Small potted plants, like water lilies that hover their pads in the air, sprout various eye components. Euphoria plucks the eye fruits with utmost care. You imagine what you would look like with one of them.
[]>zero:Would you have given me one of those?
[]>euphoria:Instead of mine?
[]>zero:Yes.
[]>euphoria:Difficult to say. On one hand, I'm proud of my work and know it's good. On the other hand, that's in the past and why should I think about what I cannot change? <mp>Besides, this is way gayer.
[]>zero:Yes it was. But you could still have depth perception, had things lined up differently.
[]>euphoria:They didn't though. I'll manage! Also, take a look at this!
[]>narrator:Euphoria giddily procures what looks like...
[]>zero:Tumbleweed? Upper body-sized tumbleweed?

[]>euphoria:A specially-shaped bit of tumbleweed! <mp>...<ap>Okay, technically its last genetic ancestor with tumbleweed is as distant as algea to tumbleweed. This is more like very filigree tulip bramble.
[]>narrator:And she rotates the brambles. You see...
[]>zero:A skull?
[]>euphoria:Rightio. Maybe we can do something with this, doesn't matter if not. But it looks cool. Maybe structural reinforcement for the titans? Maybe a soul container??
[]>zero:A what? Do you even know how to pull that off?
[]>euphoria:Not yet.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:But we'll see.
[]>zero:Keep me updated.
[]>euphoria:Will do.
[]>narrator:She puts the skullbramble back into the workbench's footrest.<mp> As she does, you give her a hug from behind. Her hair smells nice.<lc>After a few moments, you start carting away the crates of elbow joints and nod her goodbye for now.

[]>narrator:You return with the elbow joints to the grand hall you call your own workshop. Massive chunks of metal line the walls, every titan hand-built and the blueprints also of your own design. You think this was once a cathedral. You had to make... modifications to make the titans fit. Or a singular one. The finished ones get sent underground into the heartchamber. It is an arduous task, lining all the parts up, not getting distracted, but also not becoming so understimulated you relapse.
[]>zero:Hello, funny knife.
[]>narrator:You cut away the brambles from the joints you now have in your possession.
[]>zero:Noise titan...
[]>narrator:Its abdomen is filled with unfilled indentations, mimicking a lotus flower.
[]>zero:Finally, you'll have arms to play your songs. Playing all instruments, grinding the static together...<ap> Your big and lovely claws.
[]>narrator:As you finish up cleaning up the last joint, you set it down and pull back the synthetic tarp covering the half-finished arms. All of them are segmented into at least 2, sometimes 3 or even 4, rarely up to 7, segments, all ending in giant six-fingered claws. You wipe down your sweat- and oil-covered face and hands.
[]>zero:*smile*
[]>narrator:With only the hum of your workshop and its innards filling the air with noise, you start assembling the noise titan's arms. One by one, they grow into their intended forms, emerging as a powerful and terrifying display of your labor.
[]>zero:Imagine wielding one of those...
[]>narrator:You lay your prostetic arm next to one of the three-jointed ones, mimicking a grasping motion as if it were a real extension of your body.
[]>zero:Might be a bit too heavy though.
[]>narrator:It weighs as much as you and is thrice your height in length.
[]>zero:A girl can dream...

[]>narrator:You go back to work with increasing difficulty focusing. Eventually, some of the arms are lined up and have been conveyed up the wall rack, ready for assembly when you begin that work. The others still lie scattered across the floor.
[]>zero:Good enough for now... <mp>break time.
[]>narrator:Satisfied with another chunk of work done with, you plop down on top of the mini fridge you keep in your workshop, ice-cold energy drink in hand. Tomorrow, the arms will be slotted into the titan's stomach.

[]>narrator:About a week later, during your break visits, you keep noticing one particular tree growing bigger and bigger at a staggering pace.
[]>zero:Is that the one?
[]>euphoria:Yea... <ap>I call it <mp>heartroot.
[]>zero:Isn't it just a... tree? It sounds like some potato.
[]>euphoria:Pardon me?
[]>zero:You know... Like beetroot.
[]>euphoria:That's not... I guess.
[]>zero:What do you want the name to evoke then?

[]>euphoria:...beet roots aren't even potatoes...
[]>zero:But you got the point, didn't'cha?
[]>euphoria:...that I did indeed.

[]>zero:So? <mp>Name? <mp>Meaning? <mp>Invocation?
[]>euphoria:Like... a grand thing. It will have its roots deep in the heart. Holding the world you're building.
[]>zero:World...<ap> Spine. Worldspine.
[]>euphoria:Zero.<lc>Have you ever taken a look at an anatomy textbook?
[]>zero:Only at myself, oh grand architect of bodies with organs in correct places!

[]>euphoria:I didn't know where else to attach the main artery!
[]>narrator:You hope you didn't actually hurt Euphoria.
[]>zero:Well, I'm here though. So. Call it worldspine. "Machine titans, children and dwellers of the worldspine"... <ap>Doesn't that sound cool?
[]>euphoria:You don't just choose a name just because it sounds cool. It has to feel right.
[]>zero:Well if you insist, you asked me and it feels right to me *because* it sounds cool.
[]>euphoria:Only because you said heartroot sounds like a potato.<mp> But now I also can't forget that.<ap> Fine. <ap>Worldspine it is.
[]>zero:Yippie!

[]>zero:Oh oh! It's also the world's pine! The pine of the world!
[]>euphoria:It doesn't even have leaves. Just wires and lights. And if it were to have them it'd be deciduous.
[]>zero:It's a silly little pine then! Quirky and unusual!
[]>euphoria:Truly on-brand for us.
[]>zero:True!
[]>narrator:You each narrow your eyes on each other.
[]>euphoria:You're hot when you're dorky like that.
[]>zero:...[you too holy shit]
[]>narrator:And then you find yourself in a kiss with the best technoflorist in the world..

[]>narrator:Within minutes, you escalate into a makeout session against the workshop desk. Euphoria grips your nape with her still-flesh hand, digging those frail keratin-based nails into your soft and exposed neck.
[]>zero:Aren't... aren't we supposed to be working right now...
[]>euphoria:I think this is quite important spiritual work actually.
[]>narrator:Euphoria grinds their crotch on your chassis. You hold her closer.
[]>euphoria:You taste so good.
[]>zero:...<lc>What do I taste like?
[]>euphoria:Objectively? Salt and oxide and aluminum and saliva. Subjectively?
[]>narrator:Euphoria does not continue the thought before you two tonguewrestle again.
[]>euphoria:Absolute degeneracy. And also gay. Very pleasant overall.
[]>zero:God you're weird.
[]>euphoria:I know... hehe...
[]>narrator:It goes on like this, oscillating between a mental exploration of your work and shared ties, and the physical exploration of the other. <lc>You only stop when you both realize you actually have more physical work to do outside of each other.
[]>zero:Very sad.
[]>euphoria:Very sad indeed. Stay hydrated.
[]>narrator:Euphoria hands you her bottle of water. She also greases a few of your joints while you drink. You caress her while *she* then keeps up her hydration.
[]>euphoria:We'll do more of this later...
[]>zero:I'm looking forward to it, oh Euphoria.

[]>narrator:Later that night, you would find yourself tied up in your own workshop, upper chassis layers discarded. Chained up by the cold and relentless steel of the gantry originally designed to hold up the machine titans. Euphoria and you found that when sized down with adapters, they make for an amazing human-sized rig too.
[]>euphoria:You look amazing.
[]>narrator:You affirm the assessment with a small squirm. You find your vocal motor functions suspended by the only person that knows how to, right before that very same Euphoria restrained you here.
[]>euphoria:Say...
[]>narrator:Euphoria drags her razor-sharp prostretic nails across your chin, sparks illuminating the dimly-lot workshop.
[]>euphoria:Isn't it weird? You, still having such a detailed sense of pain?
[]>narrator:She snaps her wrist around below and grips your throat.
[]>euphoria:I don't know if I'd retained my old senses in your position. Might've gotten rid of some pain receptors.
[]>narrator:Her grip tightens.
[]>euphoria:Unlike you... You cute- adorable... little masochist.

[]>narrator:And a brutal kick lands in your waist, knocking the breath out of your synthetic lungs.
[]>euphoria:But that makes you even more special. Hehe.

[]>narrator:Her chest is so close. You attempt to affectionately nudge your head against it.
[]>euphoria: Awww, you're cute when you're eager like that. C'mere.
[]>narrator:And she presses your head against her sternum, arms holding you close.
[]>euphoria:...Hehehe.

[]>narrator:One arm retreats and lands right on your ribcage. That small bit of skin can still receive bruises after all. Euphoria whispers into your ear while massaging that echoing pain.
[]>euphoria:Good...<ap> good... <ap>calm...
[]>narrator:Euphoria slowly drags their hand back up to your scalp, patting you.
[]>euphoria:Good Zero.
[]>narrator:She slowly; lets go. Circles around you; Exits your peripheral vision.

[]>narrator:Unknowable. <mp>Then, a crack, and the eviscerating hooks of Euphoria's chainwhip perforate the superficial wiring and bone grafts of your back. <lc>Your lights start to flicker.<lc>Another strike. <mp>And another. <mp>And another.
[]>euphoria:Recoiling that hard, huh?
[]>narrator:This time, it lands higher up, wrapping over your shoulder into your chest.
[]>euphoria:So frail and adorable you are.

[]>narrator:One more. You cannot tell how long you passed out this time.
[]>euphoria:You're doing so well.
[]>narrator:You can feel her hugging you from behind, kissing your nape.
[]>narrator:Good Zero.
[]>narrator:Fists joined like prayer around you, Euphoria hits you right in your midriff. <mp>Your breath exits your lungs and your vision goes dark.

[]>narrator:You find yourself on the floor, caressed by Euphoria.
[]>euphoria:You did so well. I re-enabled your vocal mechanisms.
[]>zero:eee...
[]>narrator:Euphoria continues to hold you tight in her lap.
[]>zero:thaaannk yooouuu....
[]>euphoria:Enjoyed it?
[]>zero:mh-hm.
[]>euphoria:I'm glad to hear. Your bed down here is pretty close, wanna get off the floor for a bit?
[]>zero:yeah...
[]>narrator:Slowly and with the clockwork precision of the very halls you are in now, you waltz over to your bed. <mp>That night, you fall asleep to the gentle caress of Euphoria's hand across your wounded body, your lover dedicatedly spooning you.

[]>narrator:It is noon-ish and you awake to Euphoria still in your workshop, already up and very much busy.
[]>euphoria:Hii! Sorry. After, <ap>like, <ap>3 hours I felt the urge to work a bit on what you asked me for. I am currently to map out the eye placements of this cranial exoskeleton, correct?
[]>zero:Morning...<mp> yeah... that's it.
[]>narrator:She puts down her notepad and kneels down next to the bed. You exchange a thousand bite-sized affections.
[]>euphoria:I also applied the nanogel to suture yesterday's lacerations.
[]>zero:Thank you.
[]>euphoria:Always.
[]>narrator:You go through your shared morning routine. Eventually, you also get into the mood for work.
[]>euphoria:Extrasensory titan, huh?
[]>zero:Yes. Basically, all the light we cannot see, all the sounds we cannot hear... all the emotions we cannot feel.
[]>euphoria:Soooo... acid.
[]>zero:Kinda. Do some if you think it'd help the construction process.
[]>euphoria:I will... think on that.

[]>narrator:In an instant, you find yourself pinned against the structural support of the machine titan construction bay, Euphoria looming over you, mechanical hand pressed into the cold steel behind you, her other holding up your chin.
[]>euphoria:All of our unspoken desires too?
[]>narrator:Your chin is quivering in this sudden rush.
[]>zero:Any- anything inside and outside our perception.

[]>narrator:Euphoria gives you a peck.
[]>euphoria:I'll get you those retrofitted parts in the next few days.
[]>zero:Thank you.
[]>euphoria:Honor's all mine, sunshine.
[]>narrator:One small, final kiss, and Euphoria departs.

[]>narrator:You continue the work on the endo- and exo-skeletal components of the extrasensory titan. After a few days, Euphoria calls through the mesh of your workshop door.
[]>euphoria:One delivery of all the eyes for one certain Zero! <mp> Help- I literally cannot see the door handle.
[]>narrator:You open the door. Euphoria has her hands full with almost a dozen boxes.
[]>zero:Hi. Do you want me to take some of that?
[]>euphoria:No worries, just tell me where to put them.

[]>zero:Next to the ladder is fine.
[]>narrator:Euphoria puts them down.

[]>euphoria:Ocular, auditory, and pheromonal sensors. All wired up and retrofitted to slot right into those... bones.
[]>zero:Sweet! I just hooked up the first socket up there.
[]>narrator:You point to the shoulder of the machine titan.
[]>zero:Let's test it!
[]>euphoria:...Just... All of them?
[]>zero:All of the sensors of course. That's why I asked you to wire them all together. When they're all synchronized like that, they can amplify the final output almost quadratically!
[]>euphoria:Holy shit.
[]>zero:I know, right!

[]>narrator:You plug one of the sensor setups into the shoulder socket.
[]>euphoria:This is the most fucked up LED strip in existence.
[]>zero:And I thank you for it.
[]>narrator:When you step back down, you give Euphoria a kiss on the cheek.

[]>zero:So... lets switch them on...<mp> These readings are through the roof!
[]>euphoria:Is that good?
[]>zero:Totally! It means the schematics worked.
[]>euphoria:I'm very pleased then. <ap>And proud of you.

[]>narrator:You nuzzle against Euphoria's neck.
[]>zero:Thank you!!
[]>narrator:Euphoria scritches your nape.
[]>euphoria:Then my job with this is done?
[]>zero:Yep! I'll let you know when I need more parts.

[]>euphoria:Then I will go back to my plants.
[]>zero:Later!

[]>narrator:You assemble and attach the extrasensory titan's armor plating. Euphoria created some hydroponics-based muscle fibres that also find their use here. And so, soon you lower the extrasensory titan down.<lc>Another machine titan completed.
[]>euphoria:How many is this now?
[]>zero:Uhhh... I lost count.

[]>euphoria:I don't think that's good.
[]>zero:200-ish? Mayhaps?
[]>euphoria:Sounds about right.
[]>zero:But it's only four more.<ap> Nightshade - for toxicology,<mp> Apocalypse - for change,<mp> Far - for perspective and drive,<mp> and Dust - to guide them when they emerge.
[]>euphoria:Some pretty big ones to finish off, aren't they?
[]>zero:Almost like their creators, huh?

[]>euphoria:Come again?
[]>zero:Gladly.
[]>euphoria:...
[]>zero:Oh, nothing.<lc>But yes, these are pretty substantial.
[]>euphoria:Send me what you need. I'll get you those parts.

[]>narrator:Before you can respond, Euphoria plants a kiss on your lips.
[]>euphoria:There's really not much time left.
[]>zero: I know... <ap> Thank you.
[]>narrator:You share a long hug.
[]>euphoria:Wanna grab something to eat?
[]>zero:Let's do that.
You ascend from the basement and dare to step out into the sun, finding respite in your local food place.

About a month later, the final titans also have found their way down into the heartchamber. More plants were cultivated and harvested, even more parts of you repaired.<mp> Lilac blossoms adorn the nightshade titan, etchings of the sundering, ending, and beginning of worlds carved into the apocalypse titan. The far titan stands tall and watching, long strands of moor roots adorning its head and spindle-thin limbs. And lastly, the dust titan, a hulking giant of empyrean prortions and vigor.<lc>The machine titans have become whole in their numbers.

[]>narrator:Euphoria and you are standing in the very basement hallway you both have traversed a thousand times, hand in hand. <ap>Two very familiar doors before you. <mp>They each lead to your workshops, the workshops each of you has spent a great deal of time, blood, and sweat in. The fruits of your labor from these last weeks, nay, months, perhaps years by some metrics, standing in full blossom inside. <lc>This final stretch has taken a toll on you both. Euphoria had an even harder time stalling a second hearing. More parts of you had to be replaced, if the replacement parts weren't seized by the state. <lc>There is but one last task for each of you, but a final goodbye now.<mp> Neither of you will see the other again.
[]>zero:Thank you for being with me until now.
[]>euphoria:The honor and pleasure is mine just as well.
[]>narrator:You hug Euphoria as tightly as possible.
[]>zero:I'm gonna miss you though.
[]>narrator:The words barely articulate through your shaky and tear-filled voice.

[]>euphoria:Just believe in me. I'll also believe in you.
[]>zero:...
[]>euphoria:Let's build a world of our own design! We will construct this world anew! And it will be SO awesome.
[]>narrator:You squeeze harder.
[]>zero:It better be.<lc>Have fun with the ritual.
[]>euphoria:Thank you--
[]>narrator:Her voice is as flat as can be.
[]>euphoria:Good luck with the machine titans. I know you can do it.
[]>zero:We both can.

[]>zero+euphoria:And there's no one I'd rather do it with.<lc>I love you.
[]>narrator:One final deep and tender kiss, and infinite tears become your wedding dresses.
[]>zero+euphoria:I love you so <ap>so <ap>much.
[]>narrator:Seconds and hours and aeons and infinities come to pass. <mp>In a moment, the universe will return and claim both of you with its exogenous reality. <mp>You yearn to stay like this for another moment, and another, ad infinitum, but the external world finds its way to your perception yet. <mp>Shaking and crying but just as well ecstatically smiling, grinning, shining, you break away from your final embrace. The final undertakings of both Euphoria and you are demanding attention.
[]>zero+euphoria:Goodbye. <mp>I lov--

content.name: new-background-music
content.value: This Is All Too Much For Me

content.content:
[]>narrator:You barely emerge from the cave anymore. But the grand work is proceeding. Euphoria's eye gives you sight like you last had years ago, unprecendented precision and drive fueling your motions. Almost devoured by mechanical grace, you move about the workshop like a beetle across a cadaver. The heartchamber finds adornment with the last flourishes, appropriate for you life's work. Cables wired up all around, post-ritual procedures and routines set up. <mp>They span across the entire workshop, ceiling arches and stained-glass windows included.
[]>zero:Aaahhg!
[]>narrator:Your arm of flesh grows weak as you work more. You keep splicing more parts into it. Should it come to it, you can just graft a new one from the parts you have. You've seen Euphoria work.<lc>You barely rest anymore.
[]>zero:I hope at least you are enjoying the show!
[]>narrator:The ribcage-sized brambleskull Euphoria gave you has found its place atop one of your shelves.
[]>zero:You know, you're actually quite cute. <ap>I like your big eyes.
[]>narrator:It has heard and witnessed many of your frustrations and moments of genius, only rivaling how much Euphoria has gotten to see over the years.

[]>zero:You know, I doubt this will happen. But maybe, just maybe, you'll also be there with me after the ritual.
[]>zero:I won't be me of course, just scattered across all the things, everywhere and such. <mp>Euphoria is fine with just vanishing and being nothing across the cosmos. I'll be there to keep everything together. Find me in the auras of the titans, will you?
[]>narrator:The skull does not respond. It could not.

[]>zero:Well, back to work.
[]>narrator:It goes on like this. Many days pass, and eventually, you send the entire workshop system into catatonia. <mp>The pulse of the heartchamber slows, a steady and rumbling monorhythmic beat taking its place.<ap> The diagnostics on your screens and look how they ought to.
[]>zero:Just gotta seal it now. Can't let you all get messed up while the ritual does its thing.
[]>narrator:You weld the hatch shut. It takes several days to go around the entire perimeter.
[]>narrator:And then you rest.
[]>zero:I hope Euphoria is making good progress.

[]>narrator:It is deep in the night when you finally feel Euphoria's pulse resonating through your eye. Her ritual of ash is blossoming.
[]>narrator:Tears most bitter and most sweet run down your face. A few drops of blood are mixed in still, too.
[]>zero:Euphoria... my dear...
[]>narrator:Roots start breaking through the wall, embracing everything you two have lived in ever since you met each other.

[]>zero:Let me never forget your name.
[]>narrator:You inhale sharply as the roots lunge to grasp anything to envelop.
[]>zero:Euphoria...

The world is scoured by horrible winds. Entire cities find themselves sanded down to nothing within minutes. Existence itself; Buried by dust. <lc>Aeons pass, and then the air stirs. Your heart continues to beat and the machine titans awake... <ap>Emerging from the dust, they now wander and carry the weight of a thousand thoughts with them. <mp>Love, anarchy, autonomy.<mp> The secrets of alchemy and the threads of fate.<mp> Metal, bones, all the other makings of the titans, the very dust that protected them. <lc>Everything dear to you,<mp> eternal and loved.
